features.title: User Federation
features.description: Identity federation links a user's identity across multiple security domains, each supporting its own identity management system. When two domains are federated, the user can authenticate to one domain and then access resources in the other domain without having to perform a separate login process.

features.title: Rest Api
features.description: A REST API defines a set of functions which developers can perform requests and receive responses via HTTP protocol such as GET and POST. ... The World Wide Web (WWW) is an example of a distributed system that uses REST protocol architecture to provide a hypermedia driven interface for websites.

features.title: Single Sign On
features.description: Single sign-on (SSO) is a session and user authentication service that permits a user to use one set of login credentials

features.title: Authentication And Authorization
features.description: Authentication is the process of verifying who a user is, while Authorization is the process of verifying what they have access to.
